question_sentence: A live-action remake of which Disney animation hit cinemas this week?
evidence: Reviews for the CGI-heavy remake of the 2002 classic have mostly been unsparing, with The Guardian's Jesse Hassenger calling it a "monstrosity". But the live-action trend shows no signs of slowing. A live-action "Moana" is in production and due for release next year, with Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson reprising his role as Maui.

question_sentence: During an Oval Office meeting, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa joked that he couldn't gift Donald Trump what?
evidence: Before Trump confronted Ramaphosa about the "white genocide" of Afrikaner farmers, the South African president joked: "Sorry I don't have a plane to give you," to which Trump replied: "I wish you did, I'd take it."

question_sentence: Who won a run-off vote on Sunday to become the next president of Romania?
evidence: Pro-EU centrist Dan saw off far-right challenger George Simion 54% to 46%, ending a protracted and polarising presidential race that saw a first round of voting overturned by the country's constitutional court over alleged Russian interference. Dan's victory represents a "setback for Europe's surging nationalist forces", said The New York Times.

question_sentence: The US Food and Drug Administration has said Covid-19 boosters should be limited to what group?
evidence: The Trump administration's new FDA leaders plan to limit Covid-19 booster shots to people 65 and older, as well as some younger high-risk individuals. Drugmakers will be required to test vaccines again before approval. The plan is a shift from the previous policy recommending annual shots for everyone six months and older.

question_sentence: The UK-EU "reset" deal guarantees EU trawlers access to UK waters for how long?
evidence: A key part of Keir Starmer's "reset" deal with the bloc guarantees a continuation of EU fishing boats' access to UK waters for another 12 years. While some have hailed the agreement as the beginning of a post-Brexit era, hardcore Brexiteers have branded its closer ties with the EU a "betrayal".

question_sentence: The NFL is considering a ban on what controversial on-field tactic?
evidence: NFL owners met to debate the "tush push", a quarterback-shoving play perfected by the Philadelphia Eagles during their Super Bowl run. But some teams, like the Green Bay Packers, wanted it banned for safety reasons. In the end, the proposal to ban the play failed to pass.

question_sentence: New research has suggested that what punctuation mark is at risk of dying out?
evidence: According to research by language learning platform Babbel, use of the semi-colon has almost halved since 2000. The decline is being driven by a fall-off in usage among younger generations, said The Telegraph – but they are not "rejecting" the symbol; "rather, they fear using it incorrectly".

question_sentence: The UK signed a deal handing control of the Chagos Islands to which nation?
evidence: As part of the £3.4 billion deal transferring sovereignty of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius, Britain will lease the largest island, Diego Garcia, for 99 years to maintain a joint US-UK military base there, paying £101 million annually to do so.

question_sentence: France's justice minister has announced plans for a new supermax prison in which overseas territory?
evidence: Gérald Darmanin said the €400 million "supermax" jail in French Guiana, once home to France's infamous Devil's Island penal colony, will hold the most dangerous drug dealers and Islamist terrorists where they can do no harm. The move comes after a series of high-profile gang-related kidnappings, as well as attacks on jails and prison officers' homes.

question_sentence: Which country has ordered Airbnb to take down more than 65,000 rental listings?
evidence: Spain has ordered the short-term rental company to block as many as 65,935 Airbnb listings on its platform for violating rules, according to the Consumer Rights Ministry. The order comes amid a housing affordability crisis that's prompted the government to take action.

question_sentence: Former President Joe Biden was recently diagnosed with which illness?
evidence: Biden, 82, has been diagnosed with an “aggressive form” of prostate cancer, one that has spread to his bones.

question_sentence: A group of inmates facing a wide array of charges — including murder, aggravated assault with a firearm and domestic abuse battery — escaped from a jail in which city?
evidence: As 10 inmates fled a New Orleans jail, they left a misspelled message on the wall that read, “To Easy LoL.”

question_sentence: The children’s program “Sesame Street” is moving to a new neighborhood on which streaming service?
evidence: Elmo, Cookie Monster and all their friends are coming to Netflix later this year.

question_sentence: French police have recovered a bust of which famous singer that was stolen decades ago from a Paris cemetery?
evidence: Jeff Jampol, manager of the Jim Morrison Estate, told CNN that Morrison’s family was “happy to hear” of the bust’s recovery after 37 years.

question_sentence: Democratic Rep. LaMonica McIver was charged by the Justice Department with assault during a protest outside an ICE facility in which state?
evidence: Rep. McIver, who was charged following a scuffle outside a detention facility in her home state of New Jersey, said in a statement that the charges were “purely political.”

question_sentence: Which best-selling album is turning 25 this year?
choices: “Oops!… I Did It Again” by Britney Spears
evidence: Britney’s album turns 25 this year and Sony Music plans to release an expanded edition. The other three albums are turning 30 this year.

question_sentence: The FDA has given clearance to a new medical test to help diagnose which disease?
evidence: The blood test was approved for adults 55 and older who were already showing signs and symptoms of Alzheimer’s.

question_sentence: NFL owners have decided not to ban which controversial play?
evidence: The tush push is a nearly unstoppable running play that was very successful for the Philadelphia Eagles last year.

question_sentence: Actor George Wendt appeared in 269 episodes of the hit sitcom “Cheers.” Which character did he portray?
evidence: Wendt earned six consecutive Emmy nominations in the supporting actor category for his performance as Norm Peterson.

question_sentence: Oreo has partnered with singer/actress Selena Gomez to create a new cookie flavor. What inspired it?
evidence: omez was inspired by her love of horchata — a cold, sweetened drink often made from ground rice or nuts and flavored with cinnamon — for her cookie.
